CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 14, 1953, pg. 14 reads: "Red Cross Party - When Red Cross solicitations were being made last week, this group of young folks from Terrace Village met at the home of Mrs. John L. Dunson following the effort and staged a Red Cross party. Because of the bad weather during early solicitations, the drive will be extended until the end of the month.  Left to right, front row: Pauline Sisco, Betty Dunson, Idella Wilson, Byron Jamerson, and Shirley Copeland.  Second row: Lillian Dunson, Loretta Wilson, John Martin, Gleen Harvey, and Donald Christmas.  Standing: Geraldine Sisco, George Wilner, Mary Ellis, Clara Brown, Mrs. John L. Dunson, Rosie Shelton, Mrs. John E. Brice, and Mrs. William Goode. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left, front row: Pauline Sisco, Betty Dunson, Idella Wilson, Byron Jamerson, and Shirley Copeland; second row: Lillian Dunson, Loretta Wilson, John Martin, Gleen Harvey, and Donald Christmas; standing: Geraldine Sisco, George Wilner, Mary Ellis, Clara Brown, Mrs. John L. Dunson, Rosie Shelton, Mrs. John E. Brice, and Mrs. William Goode, gathered in Dunson home for Red Cross party
